snippet: The police said two parents of a Poly Prep student were arrested at their house in Queens where teenagers were drinking alcohol.
abstract: Police arrest Anthony and Claire E Reyes and charge them with providing alcohol to minors at a raucous party in their Breezy Point, Queens, home. Photo (M)5

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SARAH MASLIN NIR; Jenny Anderson and Joseph Goldstein contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: A raucous, alcohol-fueled party in the private, Rockaway Peninsula enclave of Breezy Point ended Saturday night with the parents of a lacrosse player at the prestigious Poly Prep Country Day School hauled away in handcuffs and charged with 43 counts of unlawfully dealing with children, a misdemeanor that can include serving alcohol to minors, the police said on Monday. The police said the parents, Anthony and Claire E. Reyes of Beach 220th Street, were also charged with 10 counts each of endangering a child under 17. Emergency service workers took two under-age party guests to a hospital after responding to reports of alcohol abuse at the Reyes home near Jamaica Bay, according to a Fire Department spokesman.

headline.main: Drinking Party Leads to Arrest of Parents
